tweet_translated: 6. A worker will undoubtedly value that instead of receiving a broken or damaged ticket (which even runs the risk of not being accepted in shops) he can have his money on credit or debit cards. Maximum when he knows that his competition does receive his salary as well.

tweet: 5. Comparaci√≥n con el mercado: si empresas de tu mismo nicho, por ejemplo, est√°n pagando sueldos en divisas a trav√©s de bancos internacionales o nacionales, y t√∫ no lo haces, eso definitivamente te hace menos competitivo.
tweet_translated: 5. Comparison with the market: if companies in your same niche, for example, are paying salaries in foreign currency through international or national banks, and you do not, that definitely makes you less competitive.

tweet: 4. En un proceso de auditor√≠a, cualquier persona con 3 dedos de frente le parecer√° raro que la escala salarial de toda tu n√≥mina, desde mantenimiento hasta alta gerencia y direcci√≥n gane sueldo m√≠nimo en bol√≠vares. Simplemente no es cre√≠ble.
tweet_translated: 4. In an audit process, any person with 3 fingers of forehead will find it strange that the salary scale of your entire payroll, from maintenance to senior management and direction earns minimum salary in bolivars. It just isn't credible.

tweet: 3. Intentar negar el salario en moneda extranjera, esconderlo, disfrazarlo al trabajador a la larga puede ser peor para el patrono. Al final las instituciones laborales (inspector√≠a, tribunales) son mayor dolor de cabeza.

tweet: 2. El marco regulatorio laboral venezolano no es el m√°s √≥ptimo, sin duda. De a poco y con muchas imperfecciones ha venido reconociendo la importancia del pago de salarios en moneda extranjera. Lo m√°s probable es que contin√∫e por esa senda.
tweet_translated: 2. The Venezuelan labor regulatory framework is certainly not the most optimal. Little by little and with many imperfections, it has been recognizing the importance of paying wages in foreign currency. Most likely, it will continue on that path.

tweet: 1. Nos guste o no, la econom√≠a venezolana, especialmente para el sector privado, migr√≥ de forma importante hacia el uso de moneda extranjera. Puede no gustar, estar en desacuerdo, pero esa es la realidad.
